column4: how do I move the present window to a different workspace with the keyboard?
you can right click its decorator and click send to desktop X
chromium if you add the PPA, Arora is good too
it is, uses a hell of a lot less ram than firefox too
you may need a virtual box to run the app natively to get an accurate test, you will need a windows license and install media
I suggest a mid range Nvidia and you'll be fine :)
to tell you why I would compile webkit while playing webgl and watching a video and running various cpu-hungry code
I use chrome, its a webkit based browser, but why would compiling it do something I can't already do?
people compile webkit all over the world everyday. Okay, switch "compile webkit" to "compile qt" and you have the same problem of it taking forever ...
so you use it as a speed test...?
if you just want to max your cpu, just run:  yes > /dev/null      and it will chew the cpu lotsly :)
no, I actually want to compile qt really quickly while playing with webgl and running other stuff, etc
but thanks for the link to the certified hardware
